title: Andrew Hogg (rugby league)
text:
Andrew "Andy" Hogg (birth unknown) was a Scottish professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1890s, 1900s and 1910s. He played at representative level for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a>, <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a>, <a href="Other%20Nationalities%20rugby%20league%20team">Other Nationalities</a> and <a href="Rugby%20League%20War%20of%20the%20Roses">Lancashire</a>, and at club level for <a href="Broughton%20Rangers">Broughton Rangers</a>, as a , i.e. number 2 or 5.
Hogg is one of only two people born in Scotland to have played for the <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England national rugby league team</a>, the other being <a href="George%20Fairbairn%20%28rugby%20league%29">George Fairbairn</a>.
Career.
Hogg played for <a href="Broughton%20Rangers">Broughton Rangers</a>, appearing 339 times and scoring 186 tries between 1899 and 1910.
Hogg was signed by <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> at the start of the 1910–11 season, but made only seven appearances before moving to <a href="Barrow%20Raiders">Barrow</a> in February 1911.
Hogg won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>(s) for <a href="Other%20Nationalities%20rugby%20league%20team">Other Nationalities</a> while at <a href="Broughton%20Rangers">Broughton Rangers</a> in ? against England, won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> while at <a href="Broughton%20Rangers">Broughton Rangers</a> in 1908 against Wales, and New Zealand, and won a <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a> for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> while at <a href="Broughton%20Rangers">Broughton Rangers</a> in 1908 against New Zealand.
